episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a variety of quirky and fascinating facts, including historical news singing in Europe, the surprising bite force of finches compared to T-Rexes, pollution in Kanpur, and unusual dog laws in Beijing.

facts.fact: In 17th century Europe, people used to sing each other the news.
Pound for pound, a 33 gram finch can bite you 320 times harder than a T-Rex could.
The most polluted city in the world is Kanpur, which is nicknamed the Manchester of the East.
Dogs over 35 centimeters tall are banned from Beijing.
